chapter.title: Generating Forecasts and Other Products
chapter.para: The Products menu has been designed to generate output products in the form(s) your office requires.
Note: Not all of these product generation options may be available, depending on your local office configuration.

sect2.title: Transferring the &FPA; depiction files
sect2.para: You can send some database information to other locations.

orderedlist.title: To transfer the &FPA; depiction depiction files:

listitem.para:
Choose ProductsGraphics... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Graphics Products dialog box appears.
From the List Display, select Depiction Files.
Select any of the target locations listed.
Click Send to transfer a copy of your depiction database to the selected target location.

sect2.title: Creating a graphic
sect2.para: PSMet SVGMet Some information can be displayed graphically through the PSMet or SVGMet system.

listitem.para:
Choose ProductsGraphics... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Graphics Products dialog box appears.
From the List Display, select PSMet or SVGMet.
Select one of the listed products.
Click Generate to produce a graphical representation of the selected information.

sect2.title: Creating a tabular product
sect2.para: TexMet Some information can be displayed in a tabular format using the TexMet system.

listitem.para:
Choose ProductsGraphics... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Graphics Products dialog box appears.
From the List Display, select TexMet.
Select any of the listed products.
Click Generate to create a table displaying the selected information.
Note: If you have the required text editor on your system you may be able to click Launch Editor to edit this table.

orderedlist.title: To display the status of all available products:

listitem.para:
Choose ProductsStatus... or click the clock
icon in the upper right-hand corner of the screen.
The Product Status dialog box appears listing all the products available. The status displays "No Previous Run", "Running" or the time at which the product was last generated.

sect1.title: Running Allied Models
sect1.para: allied model The available models are determined by your System Administrator. This button is greyed out and not selectable if there are no models available to run.

listitem.para:
Choose ProductsAllied Models... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Allied Model Run Select dialog box appears. ()
Select the models to be run.
Click Run.
